review: The service today was so amazing. Our server Steven was very polite and made great menu suggestions so that we could get the unlimited fruit for my son. The host was super polite, and the manager Zach really seemed to care about people having a great experience.  The food - wings were surprisingly yummy - small-ish, but perfectly cooked and juicy, which is all I look for. The sauce good - some Asian and pineapple thing.  The simple burger, sadly, as overcooked. As in, we ordered a medium, and not only was it well done, but it was chewy, dry, baaaadly well done. Mentioned it briefly to Zach, not really expecting anything, but my son wasn't enjoying it, and he offered to first replace it, but my son didn't want any more food (having filled up in fruit already), so he then said he would make an adjustment on our check ($4 off). He says that it's a thank you for the feedback. Not as awesome as a free burger, especially since the one we got was inedible, but good enough.  5 stars for the service, 1 for the burger, and 4 for the wings.

This isn't my first time at this location but I have to say, this past visit was the best experience all around since it opened in this location. First off, shout out to Alex, the waiter who was just amazing to my party. He checked in very frequently, gave great service, very polite, and just made my experience amazing. I think the service was far above and beyond. Just wanted to say thank you Alex.  The food today was great. I got my usual choice of the Bleu burger and it came out fantastic today. The steak fries were fresh every time it came out to the point where I had to let it sit so that it cooled a bit.  The place was really busy but, I was taken care of like I was the only one there. Drinks, fries, any and all refills and orders came on time and fresh. If service is like this every time and the food pipping hot like this every time, I'll go back more frequently for sure

Ugh Over $50 for 1 adult & 2 kids only to leave feeling gross like we had the same quality of slop we would have eaten at McDonalds.  I ordered the RR "Gourmet" Cheeseburger. It was super greasy, you could actually see grease puddles on the burger when the roll & rest of the toppings fell apart, which was before I was able to take my first bite. Not what I expected from a restaurant burger. It was served with a very slim handful of fries that were soggy & not good at all.  The spinach / artichoke dip wasn't too bad but not great. Also it was only served with a small amount of nachos (not enough) & some celery -? Interesting. Red onion was chopped on top which was unusual. I didn't mind but luckily the rest of the family wasn't with us because they would NOT want anything served with onions.   The kids menu doesn't offer mac & cheese as a side so we ordered that as my daughters entree & the portion size was only that of a side.  The table & menus were sticky.  In the end ~  No rush to come back.

Not bad for a chain. I like the laid back feel of the place, very family oriented. The service was absolutely wonderful. I appreciate that they try to be tech savvy.  Ordered the Royal Red Robin burger, which came with an egg, bacon and a side of garlic herbs fries. Burger was juicy and drenched in a very generous amount of mayo. Also had the boneless wings with teriyaki sauce, very flavorful. It came with a bed of potato chips...I don't get it, but sure. Also got an extra side of sweet potato fries, can't really mess that up. Good food, great atmosphere and attentive service.

I've had some issues with this establishment in the past that had led to me leaving a poor review in the past. However, I've had a great experience dealing with Assistant General Manager Frank Borelli.  Red Robin has won my favor back.  We visited last Saturday and despite the place being packed our server Alex was absolutely phenomenal. We never had an issue needing anything, he was bright, personable and I would absolutely try to have him as our server in the future. Thank you for a fantastic experience Red Robin.

For me, the number of stars a place gets is not just about the food, but also about the quality of the service. We're busy, so we don't get to eat out very often, and my hubs and I were both restaurant people for many years- so we know what goes on in the industry, standard expectations and reality alike. We had a bad first experience at our first visit to any RR when we went to one local to us. We had just about decided that we were never going again, but we were in PA visiting friends and this location was by a wal*mart where we stopped to pick up a few things. We were in about 2:30 pm yesterday- way after the lunch rush. In many restaurants, this is a time when service and food can be less than stellar. However, that was not the case at this RR.  Amy F. was our server, and she was fantastic, friendly, and very attentive. We didn't have to ask for a thing. She did a great job of explaining the menu and specials, since it was our first time at RR in a long time, and only our second visit ever.  The food was prompt and fantastically delicious. The manager even stopped by to check in on us. The restaurant was clean (even the bathrooms!!) and the overall experience was very good.

I loved Red Robin as a kid, but they've down sized on the "bottomless fries" and the quality has gone downhill since I was little.  The tower of onion rings and campfire sauce (basically mayo and BBQ but it's really good) are the only item that hasn't gone down in quality.  I had the Southern Charm burger. The patties aren't very thick, and there was something odd/cheap about the lettuce and tomato. My burger fell apart, like the patty was broken in half when I received it.  Service is great. They have these neat little touch screens where you can order food and I think play games. Ours was blinking because it was out of paper, but multiple people came over to ask about the blinking light. Only our waitress actually changed the paper, though.
Skip this place they always have flat soda and horrible service I'd like to say I'd go back ...I wont.I tried three times .That's enough for anyone to say anyway forever.

The service deserves 5 stars.The service we had was amazing. The hostess was very friendly and professional. Our server was very attentive and professional. When he saw that my fries were too salty, he offered to replace them and  they were quickly replaced with unsalted fries. I noticed other servers in action. All seemed very patient, professional and attentive to their customers. If there had been poor service in the past, that issue clearly has been addressed, at least when I was there. The food was okay for a chain place. It in no way compares to the local independent pub in the area. The burger had a better quality, pre-prepared, fast-food quality, unlike the fresh-made type of burger I am used to getting.  However, for a chain place, it will do. I give the food 3 stars based on what I ate, which was a burger and fries. Not bad but not exceptional compared to what I have access to at the same price. I am not in a hurry to return.   Both the restaurant and restroom were extremely clean.
Fantastic. Service and food was great! We were seated quickly, chicken sandwiches and salad as well as milkshakes were awesome. Very happy customer.

I have never had a bad experience here. The staff is always so welcoming and friendly. My friend and I came here for dinner the other night and our waiter brought her the wrong burger. He was very apologetic and got a new one right away. The manager even came over to apologize. I thought that was very thoughtful of them.

Huge menu. The scrumptious burgers are accompanied with bottomless steak fries. Our server Bill did a fantastic job taking care of our party of 6 with our numerous requests. Prices are reasonable. Figure $75 to $80, not including the tip. Nice, clean atmosphere and a fun, upbeat place to visit. Weekends tend to be quite busy. You wont leave hungry! Mark B. Warrington, PA

This place needs a lesson in diversity.  I was traveling alone and since I didn't want to wait was directed to the bar area.  The waiter came over and gave me a funny look when I asked him about a menu item.  He sent BRANDON the manager back who basically told me to move unless I wanted to sit AT the bar.  Since I didn't feel like driving anywhere else, I went back in the line.  I was then seated at a table and it took 5 minutes for anyone to come and ask what I wanted (and even then it wasn't my server).  Justin was the only one who stepped up in this experience and acted intelligently and without the attitude of "Why are you here?" I noted that the white family seated after me  got immediate service from my server Bill.  It is a sad thing in 2016 in PA To be treated like Mississippi 1955.  Btw: the seafood scatter platter blows.  I don't know if it was me or if they usually serve seafood, fries and coleslaw in a tiny basket and not expect it to be soggy and unappealing.  Save your money boys and girls.  For $14 I've done better in diners. In conclusion, Justin was the only good part of the experience.

Didn't expect much from this chain restaurant, but we actually had some very good food with excellent service on a weekday for lunch. My sister, our young niece & I enjoyed playing the tablet games they provide for a small fee (I believe it was 1 or 2 dollars). Would happily return!

I had a very good experience at this Red Robin location. My party of 3 only waited about 15 minutes for a table. The appetizers were brought out quickly and were delicious. I ordered the burnin' love chicken burger with a gluten free bun - I simply ordered the gluten free bun because I like it, not because I actually have an issue with gluten, however, they took it very seriously as if it were an allergy and also did not batter the jalapenos inside the burger. So, even though I don't have the allergy, it was nice to know they take it seriously! And they brought me the battered jalapenos at my request as well. The server as well as the manager were very attentive and I will certainly be back to this location again!

Got a to go order.  We were very clear that the kids burger should not have cheese due to a dairy allergy.  It was wrung up as a burger.  2 other cheeseburgers were supposed to be med rare.  When we got home the kids burger was a cheeseburger and all other burgers were very very well done.  It actually tasted like everything was burnt to a crisp.  My husband took back my childs cheeseburger because of the allergy before we even checked out everything else. So a simple meal ended with no one being happy....thanks for not making it easy....
Service was awesome food was awesome its a new place so give the place some slack. The wait wasnt long and they texted me when our table was ready. I love Red Robin and so glad it came to the area :)

We've been here a few times and each time it seems to get worse. This is the smallest Red Robin I have ever seen, which isn't good for wait times to sit (but food wait times are quite long) The hosts don't seem particularly friendly, and the servers have gotten bad as well.  The last time we went the server wasn't great, and then when we were ready to pay (aka- use the computer at the table to pay which asks you to rate your visit) she apologized for the bad service saying "I had too many... There were... We were just busy..." (They weren't half as busy as I've seen them before and had better service).  I think I've officially resigned not to go back to this red robin and wait for seating, wait for food, and have bad service.
For a chain, the burgers are fresh and delicious. Service is fast, and employees are all very nice! The endless steak fries are a bonus as well. No issues whatsoever.

So after my first review, and having contact with Red Robin customer service I decided to give it another shot. Went in on a Tuesday night around 5, was greeted within a few minutes and was seated promptly. Food was brought out within 15 minutes and was correct and hot. Waiter whom I've had before was very attentive and helpful, which was better than last time. All in all I think they've got things moving in the right direction now. I will be a repeat customer.
Orders taken promptly.  Burgers took longer than expected to come out though. Black and Blue burger was good.  A little sloppy to eat. Fries came out room temperature vs hot out of the frier.

We can't complain, we had great service and the burgers were well made. It was interesting being divided into people who were 21 and older, but it felt nice in a way. We ate the $5 Red's Boneless Wings in Teriyaki Sauce, Fiery Ghost Style Tavern Double and the BLTA Croissant. All three were delicious and we had no complaints. We also had a free dessert, because we are part of Red Robin Royalty, which you should definitely be a part of. The Fiery Ghost Style Tavern Double is definitely a burger for those who can handle some heat and the BLTA Croissant is for those who enjoy something less greasy than a burger. Other than this, the fries were good and so were the sweet potato fries. You really can't argue too much about a Red Robin. It's just a typical Red Robin chain restaurant. There is a lot of parking available and lunch time is a nice peaceful time to go. The service was good when we went, but I guess that depends on the server and day. Jeffrey was a good waiter to have around. Just go enjoy a burger why don't you?

I'm giving one star because the first time we went was pretty good. We sat at the bar, bartender was nice, the general manager (the Asian lady) was around and spoke with all the guests and the food was pretty good.  But the last experience I had with my friend was absolute shit. I mean enough to ruin it to the point where we will never come back. To any red robin for that matter. I would give negative stars if I could.  For a burger and fries joint, those are THE two things you really can't afford to mess up. Yet they did. Cold burgers. Cold fries. I asked for no salt. Of course it was extra salted. Like COME ON. I emphasized it over and over. and why the hell does it take 30 mins for my "bottomless" round of fries to come. We were finished with our burgers before the second round even came. Is that how they try to skimp you out? You'd think they would have fresh fries rolling out the kitchen but apparently waiting for COLD food is part of Red Robin's experience. The icing on the cake? The little shit waitress who hates herself and the fat obnoxious manager that weren't attentive to us at all.

As said before...I think this place has an issue with minorities. The waitress who was supposed to be taking care of us, ignored us the entire time while being extremely attentive to the non-minority tables. We asked two different people two different times just to get some napkins. It's a burger joint for god's sake, where do you expect me to wipe my hands? When the waitress finally came over, I reminded her that she forgot about my napkins and she rolled her eyes! This place gets a meh two stars at best. The hostess at the front was friendly and the burgers were mediocre. Ordered a margarita and it was the weakest drink I've ever had. This place would be so much better if they would just higher less snobby waitresses.

I was really excited to try red robin in warrington because it's new and all the commercials made it seem so tasty however in reality a glorified McDonalds - and that's being generous. The endless pit of fries came with very little and when asked for more they didn't come out until we were finished our burgers. Silverware and glassware wasn't clean and the slow almost "annoyed that we were there" service . Burgers were ok . Plates looked messy and thrown together. Do yourself a favor and don't waste ur money they seem like they could care less if you come in anyway.

We ordered take out a couple of weeks ago and they got the order wrong. One burger was missing the toppings that it was advertised with. We called the place and a rude manager lady takes the call. She apparently couldn't pull up the order. We gave her all the information she asked for and she still couldn't pull it up. After dealing with her attitude and incompetence we gave up. She toon our number down and said she would call us back. Yeah never called us back. Now, we ordered our meal. The person said 13 minutes it will be ready. We pull up 25 minutes later and shocker, it wasn't ready! Why you ask? "It never went through in the system". We proceeded to wait about 25 minutes and we walk in and guess what? It's still not done!! The manager completely avoided me and didn't even bother to come over and make sure I wasn't satisfied. And to make matters worse, one the staff members tried insinuating that I was dumb because apparently "several people call the wrong red robin". There's no other red robins around here. Rather go to Buffalo Wild Wings and get food poisoning (happened to me once) than go to this place and get horrible service.

Worst service ever. "AmyF" was our waitress, sat down, ordered after 15 minutes and nothing for another 20 minutes, meanwhile another table seated and served drinks. We had to then ask for water, got the water and that's it. Meanwhile the other table of 4 gets their food. We are still sitting there with just WATER, no appetizers we ordered or even the fries.  Meanwhile Amy walks by us numerous times almost trying not to make eye contact while helping all the tables around us (not that busy on a Monday around 3pm). Brought this up to another worker, had to finally get the manager Frank to help us. While frank helped and was nice the waitress really put us in a horrible mood, the last thing that should happen going into a restaurant. Why would we go back after leaving there feeling the way we did? They didn't even offer anything, like sorry for the poor experience here is 10% off... something!?! No, nothing but the full bill. Never again. Shame because we do love the food, the Red Robin in Hershey, PA was outstanding In every way!

Now that the place has been open a while, the service is getting faulty (forgetting silverware, slow, not readily available for the problems that arise ie burger overcooked, forgot the dipping sauce, bottomless items not getting refilled, etc.) So the food is still okay, but still not great like other locations I've visited. The managers, although nicer than before, seem a bit manic about checking-up on their staff and tables.  A lot of "is everything okay tonight" visits. Now that the long waits seem to be over, it's a solid okay place to take the family to eat in a pinch.

I like red robin a lot (bottomless fries if you pester the staff enough). Food is fine if somewhat predictable. Never had any issues with the staff. Fairly easy to find coupons online & they have always been accepted. It would have got a 5 star if it was not for those annoying terminals - touch the thing to check your order or anything and it seems to charge you a $3 usage fee.  The staff are always fine to take it off but it also kills conversation at the table when kids are playing games that did not require parent authorization to add to the bill,

I haven't been to a Red Robin in nearly 4 years because there aren't many in the area. I was excited to see there was one opening in Warrington and had planned to visit. I went yesterday and the food was very good and so was the milkshake I had. The waitress who was in training was very pleasant and accommodating. The only downfall of the whole experience was, how cold it was. It was mid 80s around the time we went but walking in was shockingly cold. I even had to run out to the car to get a hoodie to warm up.
Food was really good but they are clearly understaffed.  By the time we got our fries refilled we were basically done e
Great decision to stop for lunch on our way home!! Burgers, salad and fries were delicious!! Awesome decoration... Kyle our server was very friendly and helpful!

It would've been a five star rating if we didn't have to wait for 40 minutes to be seated but that's what you get for trying to go on Friday night around 7.  Another customer waiting with me told me that the wait times can be much, much worse. Really good shakes, excellent burgers and I'm a sucker for good steak fries.  They only bring a few out with each burger but they are "bottomless" so you can easily get more.  Our waitress was great--attentive without being annoying.  We'll be back.

I asked for a well  done burger and it was pink and bloody inside. The bun was also soggy. I've been to many other Red Robin's before and the food was delicious  and burgers were perfect. This location is a complete let down.

Meh. I remember going to them years ago and they were pretty good, was happy to have one open close by... Walked away with a very different experience this time, food was very disappointing. I had a chicken dinner that reminded me of a large chicken nugget, was able to cut with the side of my fork rather than needing a knife. The people in my party also were not impressed with their hamburgers. The fries were ok... Not visiting again, there are too many choices that serve real chicken for the same price or less...
Never again, the McD's @ the end of strip mall was better in service and food appeal, & I NEVER eat @ McD's but had no choice. This is the worst R. Robin I ever seen.

Smallest servings at any red robin ever!!! also waitress stood three tables away chatting with friends for literally 25 to 30 minutes while we flagged down random workers for help.  Finally we got the manager to help us who still managed to mess up our request.  Other red robins have been great this one was HORRIBLE.

We went on Monday June 15th, 2015 at lunch time.  No wait at all, but we were surprised to see that the restaurant was close to full. We've been to Red Robin at other locations a couple of times before and weren't too impressed.  But it's right down the street from us at this location, so we decided to give it a try.  We were pleasantly surprised. I had the Genisys burger and hubby had some kind of burger patty melt.  He also had a cup of chicken tortilla soup.  Our waiter, Stephen, was perfect and the food was hot and tasted very good.  All of it.  Even the fries.  I had forgotten that the fries really are both figuratively and literally bottomless.  As in don't pick up the cool little circular container they come in.  It's truly bottomless so the fries fall out. We liked everything about this visit, and will definitely return.  Hope the quality of the food stays consistent once the restaurant is no longer so new.

Red Robin is a very good restaurant. They have very good food and the waiters are friendly and attentive  they are always on time with your order. There Tower of onion rings are awesome and fantastic. The only thing that is not good is that the bathrooms smell horrible. But other wise Red Robin is a very good restaurant:-)
We've been here about five times since they opened.  Burgers and fries have been good each time.  Food and service has been consistently good.

First...get your morning exercise in so you can eat here. My first thought when we walked in was "why does it smell like old milk?"  Shouldn't it smell like fresh burgers. The place was not that busy yet the table next to us stayed dirty for quite some time. I ordered the bacon cheeseburger medium..got a well done cheeseburger. ..luke warm. They took it back put bacon on it and now the burger was cold. The server was nice but soooo slow. A manager had to get my partner another beer and more fries. He enjoyed his burger..so he can come back without me. If I am going to spend extra calories on a burger it better be a damned good one not a dry flat charred crappy one.

I went to red robin on Saturday for lunch and had a great experience. It has a great atmosphere and good wait service. I liked the table top electronic menu where you can order drinks, appetizers and desserts as well as call the server to the table as needed. I had the pretzel bites for the appetizer with beer cheese and I was happy with that. For my meal I had the bacon cheeseburger with garlic herb fries and it was delicious! For dessert we had the root beer float.  I would definitely go to this red robin again.

We went the week that they opened. While the food and service were both food, the restaurant design is not ideal. This location is much smaller than any other Red Robin I've ever visited. The high tops in the bar are crammed together, and you feel like you are going to get bumped on either side by a server or a customer.

Stopped in for dinner last night. We were seated right away. I was pleasantly surprised at the healthy options on the menu. My turkey burger in a lettuce wrap was well seasoned(maybe even a little too peppery for me but I'm picky) and juicy. I also like the variety of better choice sides. I had the cole slaw. It's nice to know I can indulge my family but still stay on track with my own food choices. I took a star away for the pepper!
HORRIBLE! uncooked burger! ew!!! also slow slow slow service. i would recommend going to ruby tuesday across the street!

Had to ask for utensils and napkins, bottomless fries took forever to refill, order came out wrong, waitress had to be reminded multiple times of requests for sauces, take out boxes, etc. For just having opened, this location is failing quickly. I'll drive to Neshaminey next time.

My experience at red robin was awful. We ordered specifically for a monster milkshake. (Unlimited)  for an extra dollar. My son also played two games on the store tablet , which where clearly marked as free. However, we where surprised when we received our check that our waitress Alexa had charged us for an extra milkshake for 4.99 and an extra 1.99 for entertainment. I would NEVER recommend going to this red robin. Our waitress Alexa was misleading and scammed us of our money. When asking for a refill on our milkshake, Alexa told us we should order from the store tablet, later telling us that in order to get an unlimited refill, we would have to ask for a tin. We had no idea why Alexa charged us for extra, when we ordered an unlimited milkshake and she had never mentioned an extra charge. When asking about the extra charge, she said we had ordered two milkshakes, rather than one unlimted milkshake  which was outragous when she knew we had ordered ONE unlimited milkshake. Be aware when ordering at red robines. This will be our first and thankfully last experience at ANY red robins.

Justin the server is the only reason I am giving this place any stars.  The only time we have ever had good service at this place is when Justin is our server.  The hostess is rude, almost like we are bothering her when we come in.  We always request Justin as our server.  The last time his section was full.  Justin was the only one to come up to say hello.  After 20 minutes of waiting for our waiter we walked out and had fantastic service at Buffalo Wild Wings in the same strip.

Had several failed attempts to dine here after several weeks of opening. Can't wait two hours for a burger. Finally went early Afternoon on a Thurs. and was seated right away but service was slow. Burger was good but kind of pricey. Kids enjoyed their burgers also. I think they need to work on servers being more customer oriented and quicker. That would probably reduce wait times.

For the price I'd head elsewhere. Burgers were good but the service was slow.  Close to an hour to be served both times we visted without any crowds. Unlimited fries are usless if the waitress never comes around to refill them or the drinks. I'd rather head to 5 guys and get a better burger and better service.

Terrible service. Will not go back here. The sign said they were open till 11, we went in to eat at 9:55 the hostess rolled her eyes and was super annoyed to seat is didn't say anything just slammed our menus on the table and left. All of the servers were cleaning and didn't even look at us we waited for 10 minutes and no one even spoke to us or came to get our order. We left and no one said anything. It's like they ignored us so we would leave and they didn't want to serve us. I know we came a little late but please customer service is always a good thing. And no one in that restaurant has any idea of what customer service is. I hope they didn't have a night manager it didn't look like they did. Being a manger I would never let anyone treat customers like that. You help till the end even 5 min before closing. Everyone counts.

Let's just say, I planned to come in with the family for a quick burger bite. I was told that with a party size of 7 that my wait would be 45 mins. I expressed my displeasure with a wait for that time considering that we were the only people waiting to be seated. This is when the manager Chris went into full managerial mode. He explained that if we split our party we could be seated a lot sooner. We took his advice and were seated right away. Chris then personally introduced us to our waiters and asked for us to receive only 5 star service, which we did. Way to go Red Robin Warrington...excellent service with a top notch manager.

Love burgers and fries so this is my kind of place. But, when they is a huge crowd.. So hard to get good service. Went for lunch on Sunday w family. Took forever to get our order in... And after we received order, took about 15 mins for the waitress to come by! We had NO napkins NO utensils (kids needed) and sauce that was ordered for the fries were a no show. Trying to pay and get outta there took even longer! Spent 2 hrs there in total! Sucks that one experience makes you not want to go back.
I think its great what you people write sounds like a excuse red robin is awsome but never been to this one but sounds good so 5 stars!

Our waitress was awesome and the food came out fast. Let it also be known that they messed up my order and let me keep it but at the same time got me a new one, the one I wanted, in minutes. The management and our waitress were concerned with my table and myself and was not going to let us leave unhappy. They really knew how to serve. Great work by them all, I couldn't commend them anymore. I work with food/ food service and I know they did a solid job!

I was invited to the grand opening and was very excited because I love red robin and i have a 14 month old so it's kid friendly. Gps got us lost and never found the address. Seems to be because it is a brand new shopping center it isn't on gps. Stopped to ask for directions and finally found it. We were ten min late for our reservation and our family of 3 that drove there after work from Newtown was turned away. I could see turning away someone after 30 min or so, not 10. They didn't care whatsoever when we explained the situation. We were incredibly disappointed and will not be back.
Long wait, noisy, cold fries and slow service! Won't be back any time soon!

My family of 5 received gift cards from my in-laws for Christmas to Red Robin which was great because one just opened up about 5 miles from us. So, last night we ordered takeout, $64 worth, and it was hot fresh and very satisfying, not to mention for the amount of food it was very quick. When it comes to food my wife and kids are very picky, but it was nice to hear nothing but positive compliments. Thank you Red Robin of Warrington, Pa.
Ate here a couple days after they opened. Everything was very good, and the service was excellent. We had onion rings, a couple different burgers, and their awesome fries.

Finally got a chance to try Red Robin after hearing great things about their burgers. And mine was great!  But at $14.99 one should expect a fabulous burger. My first time there was a Wednesday evening and there was a 40 minute wait. Spotted two empty spots at the bar so we grabbed those and ate much sooner. Two HUGE flaws; First issue, the place is too cramped on the bar side. The back of my bar chair constantly got bumped by staff and patrons walking by.  Second issue was how hot it was in there. We were melting. The staff behind the bar was sweating like crazy. They asked the manager to turn up the air to no avail. Staff relayed to me that the dining area is always freezing and the bar area is always hot because of a design flaw.  They work on tips behind the bar. What kind of tips can you expect when the place is too small so people eat at the bar and because it's hot they order water instead of a cocktail.   Second time we went for a late lunch, around 3:00 because I wanted to try again and see how the place felt when not cramped. It was much cooler. Service was fast. Much more enjoyable. I will come back here for a burger for sure but probably take-out or late afternoon meal.
Just wanted to say that I went to have the DGB burger again. The fries were great this time. And the burger just simply delicious, as always.

I love red robin's menu and its concept.  But this location had really bad service and wait time.  I'm surprised that a new location like this would be so unorganized and slow.  We arrived around 6:45PM on a weekday, we didn't get seated until 7:30PM.  The drinks didn't come until 7:45, food around 8:15, food portions were cold to the touch, had to send back, we were finally out of there at 8:45.  I just can't believe it took two hours to get burgers, fries and sodas together.  You have 3 people performing the hostess job, even with those fancy ipads, they still can't seat people down when there are empty tables.  Disappointing, will be driving to Quakertown's Red Robin when we feel the urge for this food...they comp'd our appetizers since it took so long, which was nice of the manager to do.  But our table had delays in apps and drinks, the table next to ours had their drinks and apps.  The table next to ours got seated after us too! But then we got our main course, while they are just getting theirs when we were done eating and paying.  Their timing is really off.
